ETYMOLOGY: From Old English ēast (east) combined with the suffix -weard (towards, in the direction of). The final '-s' is an adverbial genitive marker.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Toward the east; in the direction of the east.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We traveled eastwards along the coast until we reached the harbor.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们沿着海岸向东行进，直到抵达港口。

REGISTER: Standard; slightly more common in British English than American English.
